image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The APY Lands board has been ordered to remove general manager Richard King after a review commissioned by the state government concluded his reappointment was "a failure of proper accountable administration".

title.children: APY general manager's reappointment 'constitutionally invalid', report alleges

image.altText: A whale bursting through the surface of the ocean.

props.synopsis: It has been the most prolific year for southern right whale births on Australia's southern coastline in nearly a decade, according to researchers.

title.children: Bumper year for southern right whale births along Great Australian Bight

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A South Australian police officer accused of touching a woman's bottom has been cleared of indecent behaviour — but could have been found guilty of assault if it had been charged, a court has ruled.

title.children: Cop found not guilty of 'tickling' woman's bottom

image.altText: GettyImages-2088589379

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows star Izak Rankine has been suspended for four matches for using a homophobic slur against a Collingwood opponent during last weekend's AFL match at Adelaide Oval.

title.children: AFL bans Rankine for four games over homophobic slur

image.altText: The remains of a large puffed up globe fish sit on the sand of a surf beach.

props.synopsis: A US scientist invited to South Australia for his algal bloom expertise, says modified clay could be an effective small scale mitigation measure — but warned there is no way to predict when the bloom will disappear.

title.children: US expert says there's no way to predict when SA's algal bloom will disperse

image.altText: An aerial view of the Macquarie marshes, featuring vibrant green vegetation surrounding water containing a flock of birds.

props.synopsis: Australia has been accused of failing its international obligation to look after a Ramsar-listed ecosystem after the federal government paused environmental water flows in New South Wales.

title.children: Halt on all environmental water flows in NSW prompts anger

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at a media conference.

props.synopsis: SA's Commissioner into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Natasha Stott Despoja is no stranger to taking on a big task. Despite countless harrowing tales, she remains hopeful that can be achieved.

title.children: ‘Never been able to escape’: DV commissioner still hopeful despite harrowing stories

image.altText: A taxidermied wolf-like animal in a glass cabinet

props.synopsis: The search for what was killing sheep in South Australia's south-east caused a sensation across Australia. Questions remain about what type of animal it was.

title.children: Questions remain over Tantanoola tiger 130 years after it was shot dead

image.altText: A man in a high vis green top and a green hat in a carpark outside with a sunny blue sky.

props.synopsis: People living with disability in regional South Australia say it is hard to navigate new career paths as they do not have enough employment opportunities in their towns.

title.children: People living with disability seek more variety in job opportunities

image.altText: A person in shadow walks through a caged internal courtyard covered in more shadows.

props.synopsis: A new report has revealed isolations at South Australia's only youth detention centre increased by 50 per cent during a period last year and has questioned the legality of their use, with one respondent saying they felt they were being "punished like a dog".

title.children: 'Punished like a dog': Report reveals increase in isolations at SA youth detention centre

image.altText: Tongan king Tupou VI wearing regal dress and his crown walks towards the camera during his coronation

props.synopsis: Tonga's king has taken control of a government department in what critics say is a 'slap' to democracy in the Pacific nation.

title.children: Tonga's king 'flexes his muscles' as critics fear 'dangerous' situation

image.altText: A car parked outside a home, with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A post-mortem report had listed the victim's cause of death as "unascertained", while the alleged killer was granted release on home detention bail, but was not released as a suitable address was not identified.

title.children: Alleged murder victim's body not found for 20 days, court hears

image.altText: womans silhouette from behind looking towards a window

props.synopsis: The Office of the Health Ombudsman (OHO) has filed disciplinary proceedings against the now-retired Brisbane doctor.

title.children: Doctor accused of performing 'excessive' breast checks and vaginal swabs

image.altText: A lawyer with sunglasses outside court

props.synopsis: Zali Burrows's description of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against last year's defamation ruling neglected that her client was the applicant — and now appellant — in a civil proceeding.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer forgets key detail: the defamation case was his idea

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media in the White House Press Room.

props.synopsis: New York Attorney-General Letitia James says she will appeal the decision, which upheld the ruling that Mr Trump inflated his net worth but quashed the financial penalty set by a judge.

title.children: 'Total victory': Trump's $801 million civil fraud penalty thrown out by judge

image.altText: A woman smiles while waiving her hand in the air and wearing a 115th birthday tiara

props.synopsis: As British great-grandmother Ethel Caterham turns 116, research suggests extreme old age may be less about genes and more about paperwork.

title.children: A British researcher has uncovered the 'secret' to living to 110

image.altText: A shipping container being lifted by a gantry at a port.

props.synopsis: The deal will affect what both economies say is the "most valuable economic relationship in the world", worth $2.8 trillion each year.

title.children: US and EU release details of tariff deal, with European cars and wines hit

image.altText: Close-up of a car exhaust pipe and car exhaust smoke in an urban area.

props.synopsis: Vehicle emissions may contribute to more than 1,800 premature deaths in Australia each year, according to the nation's first assessment of the health impact of traffic-related pollution.

title.children: Car pollution's hidden death toll revealed in first national modelling

image.altText: Thaksin and Paetongtarn Shinawatra pose for a selfie holding wine glasses

props.synopsis: Thailand's suspended prime minster and her father, who previously held the top job, are preparing to hear the outcomes of their legal cases which could reshape the country's political landscape.

title.children: A leaked phone call, a hospital stay and an interview could change Thai politics

image.altText: Houses on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: People are discovering their suburbs are about to change, sometimes beyond recognition.

title.children: 'Would you want to live next to it?': Residents unhappy about proposed rezoning

image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: In coming weeks the Victorian government is set to introduce a bill to legislate Australia's first formal treaty with traditional owners. The ABC can reveal it's expected to give Victoria's elected Aboriginal body powers to establish new institutions — like a proposed education institute.

title.children: New details, educational institute revealed as Australia's first treaty looms

image.altText: Small black and white bird perches on bare tree branch against pale blue sky.

props.synopsis: A worldwide study of more than 4 million birdcalls has found that birds are singing for nearly an hour longer each day because of light pollution.

title.children: City lights turn Australia's magpie-lark into an extra early morning bird

image.altText: A blonde woman in a striped shirt leans down to talk to muppets - all are smiling

props.synopsis: After 55 years, Sesame Street still sets the standard for quality children's music. This year, SZA, Chris Stapleton, and Renee Rapp lend it their star power.

title.children: Why superstar musicians still flock to Sesame Street

image.altText: A man on stage painted all gold with a gold leaf crown and large gold skirt flowing outwards like he's been twirling around.

props.synopsis: Composer Jack Symonds and Sydney Chamber Opera have taken out multiple awards at the annual celebration of art music in Australia.

title.children: A new opera based on one of the world's oldest stories wins big at the 2025 Art Music Awards

image.altText: Gas bubbles in the middle of the sea

props.synopsis: The suspect was part of a group of people who planted devices on the pipelines near the Danish island of Bornholm, prosecutors have said.

title.children: Ukrainian man arrested over Nord Stream pipeline 'sabotage' attacks

image.altText: An anonymous woman, from the neck down, sitting on a children's bed, wearing a white sports jumper.

props.synopsis: After leaving a women's refuge, victim-survivor Maya felt "broken" and stigmatised while searching for a rental home. A new Western Sydney pilot project has changed her life completely.

title.children: 'The wrong picture': Victim-survivors stigmatised as not 'ideal' tenants

image.altText: Andrew Dillon at an AFL press conference on Izak Rankine

props.synopsis: AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon refuses to elaborate on the "compelling medical submissions" filed by Adelaide during the investigation into Izak Rankine's homophobic slur.

title.children: AFL boss addresses Rankine ban, Blues end season in style against Bombers

image.altText: A taxidermied wolf-like animal in a glass cabinet

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Did you take it all in?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A massive Qantas fine, a letter for Melania Trump and a taxidermy mystery

image.altText: Close up shot of a Aus Post express post package

props.synopsis: A Trump administration tariff deadline is creating "chaos" for postal networks and retailers globally, as low-value parcels will be slugged with import duties from next week.

title.children: Australia Post halts transit shipping to US as global carriers face 'chaos'

image.altText: Albanese and Chalmers sit on lounges in a living room smiling, as Chalmers pets a small fluffy white dog.

props.synopsis: This week in politics was all about productivity while the health minister blindsided the states and Israel's prime minister criticised Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Treasurer and PM get on the same page as Butler blindsides

image.altText: Chalmers gestures while sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has conceded Australia's tax system is "imperfect", declaring he's "won support" for broader tax reform that addresses intergenerational inequity at the conclusion of the government's three-day reform summit in Canberra.

title.children: Productivity summit ends with treasurer signalling tax reforms

image.altText: Two anonymous primary school-aged boys walk and balance on playground equipment in a park.

props.synopsis: The quicker the details of these next steps of reform are ironed out, the quicker the government and families can have certainty in a sustainable future for themselves and the NDIS.

title.children: The NDIS was never designed to support everyone. Now come the tough decisions

image.altText: A composite shows pictures of Rio Tinto and BHP signs atop tall buildings.

props.synopsis: The mining giant has taken its lobbying efforts to Washington DC after a US appeals court temporarily blocks the Trump administration from handing a sacred tribal site over to Resolution Copper.

title.children: Donald Trump backs BHP, Rio Tinto over US copper mine

image.altText: Kylie Minogue standing on stage with four members of K-pop boy band Ateez

props.synopsis: A new music competition show in which global icons team up with K-pop idols to have their songs KPopped features Australian pop princess Kylie Minogue.

title.children: What does it mean to have your song KPopped? Kylie Minogue, the Spice Girls and Boy George find out
